The most critical part of bioinspired superwetting material design is synergistic action between hierarchical dual-scale structures and the intrinsic material properties.
1, 9, 14 Basically, two biomimetic principles can be summarized: Hierarchical dual-scale structures have played a key role in determining the wetting property. The arrangement, orientation, and curvature of micro-/nanoscale structures can control the motion of the liquid.
